CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial;Violation of Article 8 - Right to respect for private and family life;Violation of Article 13+6 - Right to an effective remedy (Article 6 - Right to a fair trial);Violation of Article 13+8 - Right to an effective remedy (Article 8 - Right to respect for private and family life)
JUDGES: András Sajó;Françoise Tulkens;Ireneu Cabral Barreto;Nona Tsotsoria;Vladimiro Zagrebelsky
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant married PERSON
CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE their children GPE and GPE , respectively , were born .
CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant and PERSON started having marital problems .
CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON moved out , but the children remained with the applicant .
CARDINAL . NORP On DATE the applicant filed a claim with ORG in GPE ( “ the ORG ” ) , seeking the dissolution of marriage , the custody of the children and a contribution to their maintenance .
CARDINAL . In DATE PERSON spent DATE with the children , but failed to return them to the applicant thereafter .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG : ( i ) dissolved the marriage ; ( ii ) granted custody of the children to PERSON ; ( iii ) ordered the applicant to pay DATE child maintenance ; and ( iv ) ruled that the applicant could spend DATE with the children , as well as DATE of their winter and summer holidays , respectively .
CARDINAL . By DATE this judgment had become final .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed a claim with ORG , seeking custody of ORG and ORG as well as the amendment of the maintenance ordered .
CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON filed a separate claim with ORG , seeking the amendment of the applicant ’s access rights .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG joined these proceedings into a single case .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant withdrew his claim in respect of ORG

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ruled against the applicant and partly in favour of PERSON In particular , the court ordered that the applicant would be entitled to spend time with GPE and GPE each DATE TIME , thereby restricting his prior access rights .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date thereafter this judgment would appear to have become final .
CARDINAL . Having apparently been refused access to the children by PERSON , on DATE the applicant filed an enforcement request with ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG issued an enforcement order , stating , inter alia , that PERSON would be fined MONEY should she fail to comply therewith .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant informed ORG that he had been denied all access and requested that the conditional fine now be imposed .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected this request as premature , stating that PERSON had received the order in question on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG confirmed its decision of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant informed ORG that his contact with the children was dependent upon the whims of his former wife and noted that the final judgment of DATE was being ignored .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG decided to impose the said fine and again ordered PERSON to respect the applicant ’s access rights .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG based in GPE ( “ the ORG ” ) informed the court that the applicant had not been in touch with them . They further noted that PERSON had stated that the applicant had not shown any initiative to see the children . Lastly , ORG proposed that the enforcement proceedings be terminated .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG confirmed its decision of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered PERSON to pay MONEY in costs .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG scheduled a hearing for DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG cancelled this hearing , terminated the enforcement proceedings and reaffirmed its order of DATE . As regards the termination , it referred to the judgment rendered in DATE and relied on the provisions of LAW ( see paragraph DATE below ) .
CARDINAL . Having received this decision , the applicant failed to file a formal complaint against it ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON paid the fine first imposed on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found the applicant guilty of failing to pay child maintenance DATE and DATE and sentenced him to DATE in prison , suspended for DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG revoked the suspended sentence and ordered the applicant to serve DATE in prison .
CARDINAL . On DATE this decision became final and on DATE the applicant started serving his sentence . On DATE , however , ORG ordered that the applicant be released on parole .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG confirmed that GPE had effectively been living with the applicant since DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the said centre observed that : ( i ) the enforcement proceedings had been ineffective due to the uncooperative attitude of the children , as well as their mother ; ( ii ) the contact between the applicant and the children had been re - established in DATE ; ( iii ) in DATE and DATE , respectively , GPE had fled to the applicant ’s home ; and ( iv ) the applicant himself could not be considered to be a positive influence on her .
CARDINAL . On DATE GPE again went to stay with the applicant . Ultimately , however , she was returned to her mother by ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE GPE stated , inter alia , that she would prefer to live with the applicant .
CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON stated that he wanted to stay with his mother , but was willing to maintain regular contacts with the applicant .
CARDINAL . It would appear that in DATE both GPE and PERSON had been staying with the applicant , which is why on DATE he had been ordered by ORG to return them to their mother .

CARDINAL . In a separate case , on DATE ORG ruled that PERSON was legally entitled to have GPE removed from the applicant ’s home , where she had stayed temporarily . By DATE this judgment became final and GPE returned to live with her mother .
CARDINAL . Following the dissolution of his marriage with PERSON , the applicant remarried and fathered another CARDINAL children .
CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the applicant was diagnosed as suffering from hypertension , hypoglycaemia and spondylosis .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( GPE sluzba za zaposljavanje ) confirmed that the applicant had been formally unemployed DATE , except briefly DATE and DATE . It would appear , however , that he had worked unofficially during this time and had been an occasional recipient of various social benefits .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL provides that enforcement proceedings “ shall be terminated ex officio if the ... [ title being enforced ] ... has been ... repealed , reversed , annulled , or otherwise rendered ineffective , or the certification of enforceability has been ... revoked ” .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL provides that the creditor shall have the right to file a complaint against a decision adopted , inter alia , on the basis of Article QUANTITY .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL , while placing special emphasis on the best interests of the child , states that there shall be an initial period of DATE for voluntary compliance with a child custody and/or access order . Beyond that , however , fines shall be imposed and , ultimately , if necessary , the child shall be taken forcibly , in co - operation with ORG .

CARDINAL . LAW entered into force in DATE , thereby repealing LAW CARDINAL . In accordance with LAW , however , all enforcement proceedings instituted prior to DATE are to be concluded pursuant to LAW .
